text:
Here his rags did not attract contemptuous attention,
and one could walk about in any attire without scandalising people.

Who thinks
of that?

I think
that’s all nonsense and there’s no need of softness; on the contrary,
what’s wanted is protest.

It’s interesting to look on and listen... and I am really
glad you have come forward at last.”

“But you might give us some tea!

Hang
them!

But I’ll confess
frankly, I am very much bored.

But
again the porter was not at home, and he succeeded in putting the axe
back under the bench, and even covering it with the chunk of wood as
before.

Would it not be better to go
somewhere far off, to the Islands again, and there hide the things
in some solitary place, in a wood or under a bush, and mark the spot
perhaps?” And though he felt incapable of clear judgment, the idea
seemed to him a sound one.
Understand me!

He suddenly fancied that her long
black eyelashes were quivering, as though the lids were opening and a
sly crafty eye peeped out with an unchildlike wink, as though the little
girl were not asleep, but pretending.
I am not going to them.
“And why should they compensate me?

When I asked him where he got
them, he said that he picked them up in the street.
Stay here, stay!

And then you asked so
piteously for fringe for your trousers.

What idiotic ideas come into one’s head.”

To reach the police office he had to go straight forward and take the
second turning to the left.

“I suppose you didn’t expect it?” said Raskolnikov who, though he had
not yet fully grasped the situation, had regained his courage.

But at that instant someone seized him from behind, and a
police constable stood between them.

Come, Dounia.... And you, Rodya, had better go for a little
walk, and then rest and lie down before you come to see us....
Don’t laugh, and don’t be angry!

“Oh, no, no, no!”

And Sonia unconsciously clutched both his hands, as though imploring
that she should not.
Good God!

Then with a wave of his hand he
went into the house but stopped short of the stairs.

And the next day I heard that someone had murdered Alyona Ivanovna and
her sister, Lizaveta Ivanovna, with an axe.
Ha, ha!

“Let us go, sir,” said Marmeladov all at once, raising his head and
addressing Raskolnikov--“come along with me... Kozel’s house, looking
into the yard.

That cannot be!”

And Sonia’s face worked with awful terror.

I’ve found out where those mothers live and in
what surroundings.
But the coachman was not very much distressed and frightened.

When I’d finished and had
gone out, I’d come back, ‘No, excuse me,’ and ask for some explanation.

The staircase
got darker and darker as they went up.

“Allow me to ask what are you alluding to,” began the clerk, “that is
to say, whose... about whom... did you say just now...
And you will see what an accommodating person I am.

Life had stepped
into the place of theory and something quite different would work itself
out in his mind.

A minute later he
was in the street.

“What is he talking about?” he wondered distractedly, “does he really
take me to be innocent?”

“What am I driving at?

“It’s
in accordance with your theory!”

“In accordance with my theory?”

“Why, carry out logically the theory you were advocating just now, and
it follows that people may be killed...”

“Upon my word!” cried Luzhin.
At last he returned to complete consciousness.

“What is it?” she asked once more, scanning Raskolnikov intently, and
weighing the pledge in her hand.
“It must be the top drawer,” he reflected.

Break what must be broken, once for all, that’s all,
and take the suffering on oneself.

Zametov, left alone, sat for a long time in the same place, plunged in
thought.

Meanwhile Raskolnikov, who had turned a little towards him when he
answered, began suddenly staring at him again with marked curiosity, as
though he had not had a good look at him yet, or as though something
new had struck him; he rose from his pillow on purpose to stare at
him.

“And what a chance I have lost for ever!” he muttered,
standing aimlessly in the gateway, just opposite the porter’s little
dark room, which was also open.
I have muddled it!” Porfiry slapped himself on the forehead.
They’ve talked of madness already, I noticed.)

Pass!”

And he took another drink of vodka.

Evidently Marmeladov was a familiar figure here, and he had most
likely acquired his weakness for high-flown speeches from the habit of
frequently entering into conversation with strangers of all sorts in
the tavern.

His lips worked,
helplessly struggling to utter something.

“I’ll fetch
you a cab and take you home myself.
